CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The text variable is directly inserted into the HTML of the pseudoElem element without proper sanitization or escaping. If an attacker can control the value of text, they can inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript code into the page, leading to a variety of attacks such as stealing sensitive information or performing actions on behalf of the user.
